issue.title: Always use UNC (long) paths on Windows.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
EDIT: Can be merged (after review)

Paths in local file systems are now all absolute. 

Changing "\" to "/" prior to that makes "C:\" change to "C:/", which is incorrectly interpreted as _current directory_ by `filepath.Abs()`, so we cannot use `filepath.toSlash()` before we make the path absolute.

Fixes #124 

TO REVIEW: `filepath.ToSlash()` is removed for ALL filesystems, so they will be served the raw path. This means that "ACD:\filedir\" is no longer changed to "ACD:/filedir/", but that should be handled by each FS, if we keep it as is.

issue.title: Request the ability to format -v --stats for limited scrollback

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Hi!

We understand you are having a problem with rclone or have an idea for an improvement - we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue.  We'll reply quickly and it won't increase our massive issue backlog.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

If you have an idea for an improvement, then please search the old issues first and if you don't find your idea, make a new issue.

Thanks

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

When I run a rclone task that may take a while, I run it through tmux. I can check in on it as needed by opening an attached --read-only tmux session. I add read-only in case my cat decides to run across the keyboard.

If I am running a substantial number of --transfers, the primary info scrolls up before I can read it. Would like the option of seeing the INFO and the current transfers if possible, even if the first part of the transfers list is scrolled out of view.

Suggesting the Transfers list be displayed before the INFO printout, or the ability to format / set order. 

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.43.1
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.11

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux Mint 4.15.0-34-generic #37-Ubuntu x86_64 GNU/Linux

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone sync ${SOURCE_PATH} ${DESTINATION_PATH} \
  --backup-dir ${ARCHIVE_DESTINATION_PATH} \
  --exclude-from ${EXCLUDE_FILE} \
  -v --skip-links \
  --transfers=32 \
  --checkers=16 \
  --drive-chunk-size=16384k \
  --drive-upload-cutoff=16384k \
  --stats 15s \
  --delete-excluded
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2018/09/17 07:15:37 INFO  :                                          
Transferred:      400.710M / 435.946 MBytes, 92%, 131.474 kBytes/s, ETA 4m34s
Errors:                45                                            
Checks:              1171 / 1171, 100%                               
Transferred:         1450 / 2537, 57%                                
Elapsed time:     52m0.9s                                            
Transferring:                                                        
 *   .../New-Minty/cinnamon/img/controls/off.svg:  0% /3.224k, 0/s, -
 *   .../cinnamon/img/controls/close-pressed.svg:  0% /5.592k, 0/s, -
 *   .../cinnamon/img/controls/entry-focused.svg:  0% /4.586k, 0/s, -
 *   .../cinnamon/img/controls/scroll-handle.svg:  0% /4.243k, 0/s, -
 *   .../controls/calendar-arrow-right-hover.svg:  0% /3.827k, 0/s, -
 *   ...amon/img/controls/close-simple-hover.svg:  0% /5.211k, 0/s, -
 *   ...cinnamon/img/controls/hotcorner-icon.svg:  0% /4.938k, 0/s, -
 *   ...controls/radiobutton-checked-focused.svg:  0% /4.258k, 0/s, -
 *   ...ew-Minty/cinnamon/img/controls/close.svg:  0% /5.584k, 0/s, -
 *   ...ew-Minty/cinnamon/img/controls/entry.svg:  0% /4.275k, 0/s, -
 *   ...g/controls/calendar-arrow-left-hover.svg:  0% /3.819k, 0/s, -

```

issue.title: OAuth Token fetching process won't start when configuring Drive with SA

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Rclone won't start the OAuth fetch Token process after running a config edit or a new configuration wizard when setting up service Accounts. 
Tried it with current stable release and beta release.
Tried it by editing current configuration from regular OAuth API Keys to SA, and creating a fresh new config from 0. 

In all situations when it gets to the point where it normally would ask to fetch the OAuth token by starting the browser  or by using the URL, it hangs for a brief second or two, and moves on to the Teams Drive question.  Under no circumstances it lets you fetch the token.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.52.1
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.14.4

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
5.4.0-33-generic #37-Ubuntu SMP Thu May 21 12:53:59 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone config

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```

rclone v1.52.1
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.14.4
user@computer:~$ rclone config

====                 ====
```
